island_underground2_set2
Got Verigil ring
placed ring on tomb
Got Eyvipa candlestick
placed candlestick on tomb
Got Cuned's diary
Placed diary on tomb
Got Jerelin's seal
Placed seal on tomb
Got Audela's necklace
Placed necklace on tomb
laerothbasement2_chest_looted
I gave Gylew the Korhald chest.
Jerelin grave moved
I traded 5 of my 'mermaid coins' to Gylew for 500 gold.
I foolishly gave 5 of my 'mermaid coins' to Gylew.
I have agreed to set off to Laeroth Manor in persuit of the Korhald coins and to bring them back to Gylew.
I  sold the 10 coins that I looted from the Arulir secret room to Gylew.
I gave Gylew the 10 coins that I looted from the Arulir secret room.
In the Laeroth basement, I noticted a sign on the wall that i could not read in it's entirety, but I was able make out the name 'Korhald'. This makes me wonder if this is a clue?
In the Laeroth basement, I discovered and looted the chest containing the 'Korhald coins'.
I've decided to help Forenza by agreeing to get the second key from Gylew. I should go back to Gylew now.
I have decided to attack Forenza. I should return to Gylew with the key once he is dead.
We discovered a mysterious map inside the Korhald chest and I need to follow the river going east.
I have decided to attack Gylew. I should return to Forenza with the key once he is dead.
Inside the Korhald cave, I found the Coin of prestige and the Shield of the brave. I should return to Forenza and show him the coin.
Inside the Korhald cave, I found the Coin of prestige and the Shield of the brave. I should return to Gylew and show him the coin.
I sold Gylew the Coin of prestige and he rewarded me handsomely for it.
I gave Gylew the Coin of prestige and he told me that if I ever make my way to Feygrad, to seek out his family and they will 'make that shield a little bit better". Whatever that means.
I sold Forenza the Coin of prestige and he rewarded me handsomely for it.
I gave Forenza the Coin of prestige and he told me that if I ever make my way to Brightport, to seek out his family and they will 'reward" me. Whatever that means.
I met a caretaker at Laeroth manor. He said he cannot leave because he is bound by an oath, but not one he ever gave.
The caretaker said that he feels honor bound by a pledge that his great-great grandfather made many years ago.
Moriath told me only the past lords can release him from the oath, but they are dead. He suggested I look in the library for information about how to talk to them.
I have learned the chant needed to send spirits back to their rest on the other side.
I have learned how to raise the spirits of the dead. But I need a personal item. I should talk to Moriath again.
Moriath suggested I search the master bedroom for a personal item from the last lord, Veregil.
Verigil told me he could not release the Caretaker from his oath, because he is from the wrong branch of the family. I must talk to his uncle, Eyvipa. He has gone back to his rest.
Moriath suggested I look for an item with "E" engraved on it. This would have belonged to Eyvipa.
I have found an expensive looking candlestick with "E" engraved on it. This must have belonged to Eyvipa.

Eyvipa was angry that I woke him from his rest. He refused to help me because his father passed him over, and made his younger brother lord. I had to send him back to his rest with the chant "estray inyay eacepay".
I found a diary that must have belonged to Cuned.
Cuned told me that Verigil is correct, and he cannot release the caretaker from his oath because he is from the wrong branch of the family. I must talk to his father, Jerelin.
After much searching I found a seal for Jerelin in an old chest. I must go back to the tomb again.
Jerelin ignored me, ans went back to his resting place. I will have to ask Cuned again what to do.
Cuned told me to speak to his mother, Audela. Jerelin didn't listen to many people, but he listed to her.
I have found what appears to be a jewelry box, with "A" inscribed on it. It is locked though, and too heavy to move to the tomb.
I have found a key in the bedroom.
The key fitted the jewelry box! Inside I found a necklace "With love to Audela" written on the back.
Audela told me to talk to Jerelin again, but tell him Audela wants this done.

I spoke to Jerelin again, and told him of Audela's wishes. He told me he will reease the caretaker, but with a condition. The caretakers last act must be to move his grave away from that of his sharp tounged wife.
I told the caretaker what he has to do to be released from the oath. He thanked me, and agreed to do it.

I noticed that Audela had reappeared in the tomb. I spoke to her, and she was annoyed that even in death her husband had disappeared again, but she would find him, and give him a good talking to. I sent her back to her rest with the chant "estray inyay eacepay"
